item.title: Draining the (Big Data) Swamp
item.description: Before we dive too far into this article, let’s define a few key terms that will come up at several points: Big Data - Technology relating to the storage, management, and utilization of “Big Data” (e.g. enormous amounts of data/petabyte scale). Data Lake - A common term to refer to a storage platform for Big Data. In this case, let’s assume Apache Hadoop (HDFS) or Amazon S3. Data Warehouse - A large store of data sourced from a variety of sources within a company, then used to guide management or business decisions.
